gobblin.writer

Class PartitionAwareDataWriterBuilder<S,D>

  • java.lang.Object
    • gobblin.writer.DataWriterBuilder<S,D>
      • gobblin.writer.PartitionAwareDataWriterBuilder<S,D>
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    FsDataWriterBuilder

    public abstract class PartitionAwareDataWriterBuilder<S,D>
extends gobblin.writer.DataWriterBuilder<S,D>
    A DataWriterBuilder used with a WriterPartitioner. When provided with a partitioner, Gobblin will create a DataWriter per partition. All partitions will be build with identical builders, except that forPartition(org.apache.avro.generic.GenericRecord) will specify the partition.

    The contract with the PartitionAwareDataWriterBuilder is as follows: * Gobblin will call validatePartitionSchema(Schema) before calling build(). * Gobblin is guaranteed to call validatePartitionSchema(Schema) for some instance of PartitionAwareDataWriterBuilder with the same class, but not necessarily for the specific instance that will be used to build the DataWriter. * If !partition1.equals(partition2), then Gobblin may call build a writer for partition1 and a writer for partition2 in the same job. This should not cause an exception. * If partition1.equals(partition2), a single fork will not build writers for both partitions.

    The summary is: * Make sure validatePartitionSchema(org.apache.avro.Schema) returns false if the writer can't handle the schema. * validatePartitionSchema(org.apache.avro.Schema) should not have any side effects on the PartitionAwareDataWriterBuilder. * Different partitions should generate non-colliding writers.

      • forPartition

        public PartitionAwareDataWriterBuilder<S,D> forPartition(org.apache.avro.generic.GenericRecord partition)
        Sets the partition that the build DataWriter will handle.
        Parameters:
        partition - A GenericRecord specifying the partition.
        Returns:
        A PartitionAwareDataWriterBuilder.

      • validatePartitionSchema

        public abstract boolean validatePartitionSchema(org.apache.avro.Schema partitionSchema)
        Checks whether the PartitionAwareDataWriterBuilder is compatible with a given partition Schema. If this method returns false, the execution will crash with an error. If this method returns true, the DataWriterBuilder is expected to be able to understand the partitioning schema and handle it correctly.
        Parameters:
        partitionSchema - Schema of GenericRecord objects that will be passed to forPartition(org.apache.avro.generic.GenericRecord).
        Returns:
        true if the DataWriterBuilder can understand the schema and is able to generate partitions from this schema.
